title: The Exploration Company claims partial success of Mission Possible reentry spacecraft
summary:
The Exploration Company said it achieved “partial success” on a test flight of a reentry capsule but lost the spacecraft before it splashed down.

title: The Exploration Company Declares Mission Possible a “Partial Success”
summary:
In-space logistics startup The Exploration Company has declared its Mission Possible flight both a partial success and a partial failure following a successful reentry. As The Exploration Company works toward the inaugural flight of its full-scale Nyx spacecraft, it has used a series of subscale demonstrators to validate key technologies. The first, Mission Bikini, was […]
The post The Exploration Company Declares Mission Possible a “Partial Success” appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Laser rangefinder problems blamed for second ispace lunar lander crash
summary:
Japanese company ispace says it believes its second lunar lander mission crashed because of problems with a laser rangefinder used to determine altitude during its descent.
The post Laser rangefinder problems blamed for second ispace lunar lander crash appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Ukraine and partner countries to raise funds for imagery satellites to lessen reliance on the U.S.
summary:
A consortium of Ukrainian, Nordic and eastern European companies is hoping to raise more than 100 million euros ($115 million) to build a constellation of 70-plus imagery satellites that would provide intelligence along Russia’s border.

title: NASA’s SLS Solid Rocket Boosters: What is DM-1?
summary: Demonstration Motor-1 (DM-1) is the first full-scale ground test of the evolved five-segment solid rocket motor of NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket. The event will take place in Promontory, Utah, and will be used as an opportunity to test several upgrades made from the current solid rocket boosters. Each booster burns six tons of […]
